Description: Tetradrachm of Samos with the head of a lion. Weight: 12.80 gm.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the 'Silversmith's Hoard'; see Petrie's Journal 1884-5,139, where he states it was found casually and that he visited the site, but does not specify the location. Wrongly stated to have been found by Petrie by Head in Petrie 1886, 65. See also J.P. Barron, The Silver Coins of Samos 76-7 for the hoard and pl. XII 66e for this coin, and the discussion by H. Mattingly of the date, c.450 or early 430s, in JHS 101 (1981) 82-85.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (UA.034)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
